We get `TRUSTEE can not touch {color:red}role{color} field since only the owner can modify it` when we demote nym from some role using None instead of \\u0027\\u0027 and than try to promote it back to some role \\u003c\\u003c we should fix this behaviour to reject None-based demotions as an option maybe.\\r\\n2. We get `TRUSTEE can not touch {color:red}verkey{color} field since only the owner can modify it` when we add nym with None role and than try to add some role to it sending verkey together with new role \\u003c\\u003c this is not a valid case in the current auth map since we should add\\\\remove roles to existing nym without verkeys\\u0027 sending and this reject is expected.","created":1.55377749E12,"updated":1.553777522E12,"internal":false},{"id":"58685","author":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"updateAuthor":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"body":"Re: #2, good catch. If the trustee builds and sends a NYM request with a verkey value of None along with the role of TRUST_ANCHOR, the test passes. I think I have to change my side a bit to accommodate -- I was sure it used to work at some point if the verkey value was the same as what was on the ledger, but (a) I could be wrong and (b) the right thing is not to send the verkey for a role change.\\r\\n\\r\\nI\\u0027m still not totally convinced it\\u0027s clean: let me toy with it a bit more.","created":1.553786269E12,"updated":1.553786866E12,"internal":false},{"id":"58688","author":{"key":"vladimirwork","active":true,"email":"vladimirshishkinwork@gmail.com","displayName":"Vladimir Shishkin","username":"VladimirWork"},"updateAuthor":{"key":"vladimirwork","active":true,"email":"vladimirshishkinwork@gmail.com","displayName":"Vladimir Shishkin","username":"VladimirWork"},"body":"\\u003e I was sure it used to work at some point if the verkey value was the same as what was on the ledger\\r\\nYes, in old auth map it was acceptable but in new auth map we treat it as verkey rotation even if verkey is the same so verkey rotation should be performed without role value filled and role rotation should be performed without verkey value filled in the latest versions.","created":1.553786579E12,"updated":1.55378661E12,"internal":false},{"id":"58692","author":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"updateAuthor":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"body":"I\\u0027ve reproduced case #1 with the attached replacements to conftest.py (conftest-ta-none-ta-identity_my.py). Pytest, in building identity_my fixture as specified, now attempts to proceed with:\\r\\n1 - TRUST_ANCHOR\\r\\n2 - \\u0027\\u0027 (for role change)\\r\\n3 - None (minimal USER)\\r\\n4 - \\u0027\\u0027 (role change)\\r\\n5 - TRUST_ANCHOR.\\r\\n\\r\\nThe operation succeeds through #3, but fails on #4 with\\r\\n-----\\r\\n.. NYM response {\\r\\n \\"identifier\\": \\"V4SGRU86Z58d6TV7PBUe6f\\",\\r\\n \\"reason\\": \\"client request invalid: UnauthorizedClientRequest(\\u0027TRUSTEE can not touch role field since only the owner can modify it\\u0027,)\\",\\r\\n \\"reqId\\": 1553787420738213443,\\r\\n \\"op\\": \\"REJECT\\"\\r\\n}\\r\\n-----\\r\\nThe error message implies a glitch in logic, since the TRUSTEE should have permission to modify the role field. I believe this is the case #1 you\\u0027ve outlined above.\\r\\n\\r\\nDo we agree that there is still something to look into here?\\r\\n\\r\\nIn particular, moving off role\\u003dNone (via role\\u003d\\u0027\\u0027 for replacement step) should either succeed or else documentation should reflect the fact that there is some other process to add a role beyond minimal USER (role\\u003dNone).","created":1.553787952E12,"updated":1.553787952E12,"internal":false},{"id":"58693","author":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"updateAuthor":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"body":"... as it turns out, moving off Role\\u003dNone does not require the intermediate step of sending Role\\u003d\\u0027\\u0027. If instead the sequence proceeds like this:\\r\\n1 - TRUST_ANCHOR\\r\\n2 - \\u0027\\u0027 (for role change)\\r\\n3 - None (minimal USER)\\r\\n4 - TRUST_ANCHOR\\r\\n\\r\\nthen the operation completes successfully. Since \\u0027\\u0027 corresponds to ROLE_REMOVE in the indy-sdk comments, and in a sense Role\\u003dNone (meaning USER), one can argue that removing a role of None doesn\\u0027t make sense from point of view of pure data.\\r\\n\\r\\nI will adapt my code to the reality.","created":1.553788228E12,"updated":1.553788228E12,"internal":false}],"internalMap":{},"reporter":{"key":"sklump","active":true,"email":"stephen.klump@becker-carroll.com","displayName":"Stephen Klump","username":"sklump"},"priority":{"id":"2","name":"High","description":"Serious problem that could block progress."},"labels":[{"label":"node-SDK"},{"label":"EV-CS"},{"label":"TShirt_S"},{"label":"quality"}],"customKeys":{},"workLogs":[],"issueType":{"id":"10004","name":"Bug","description":"A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product."},"affectedVersions":[],"entityProperties":{},"status":{"id":"10200","name":"New","category":{"id":2.0,"key":"new","name":"New"}}},"issueUrl":"https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/INDY-2033"}

Logan","username":"btl5037"},"updateAuthor":{"key":"btl5037","active":true,"email":"brett.t.logan@ibm.com","displayName":"Brett Logan","username":"btl5037"},"body":"With every new version of Fabric it was introduced, devmode has broken because there were, and remain, no mainline tests for it. After every release someone is invariable left to find and fix the issues in devmode. With the vast reach of the major changes to lifecycle and chaincode in 2.0, we knew there was a strong possibility devmode wouldn\\u0027t work anymore. We tried to get testing in before 2.0, but ultimately decided we didn\\u0027t have the bandwidth and not having devmode didn\\u0027t break any functionality to prevent the release.\\r\\n\\r\\nAnd honestly there are better tools for writing and testing smart contracts than devmode these days, like the Open Source IBM VS Code Extension which deploys fabric and provides the ability to do rapid chaincode iterations.\\r\\n\\r\\nWhile the maintainers do the best they can to maintain everything, we have to remember, Fabric is an open source project. The maintainers have to prioritize and are a limited in the number of features they can support. Open source projects rely on the fact that anyone and everyone is welcome to contribute. If someone in the community wants to tackle fixing devmode and even adding tests for it, we would greatly welcome the contribution.\\r\\n\\r\\nWhile I\\u0027m sure not the answer you want to hear, this Jira will remain open until we can prioritize the work or someone in the community provides a solution.
